Message.Title: BUY DRAM $2.3 BEFORE IT FLIES TO $20.......MEMORY PRICES WAY UP ....GREAT for 1.5M SHARE FLOAT DRAM!
Message.Msg: DRAM recently executed a 1/6 reverse split and now the market cap in only $4 Million with revenues of about $30M and on the verge of returning to profitability big time. Take a look a typical news item talking about the recent boom in memory prices.....DRAM's bread and butter....but not the only product they have. DRAM Prices on the Rise Published March 12, 2013 | By JimHandy There’s been a lot of talk recently about increasing DRAM prices. Although this trend has been ongoing since late November (see chart) it has only recently garnered the attention of the press. What is going on, and how is it likely to play out? The prices in the chart represent the lowest spot market prices reported by market tracker InSpectrum for the past year. These prices typically remain below contract prices as long as there is an oversupply, and stay above contract prices during a shortage. According to InSpectrum’s figures, today’s lowest spot market DRAM prices are about double their lowest point, and rose above contract prices in January. This is about two quarters earlier than Objective Analysis expected, so The Memory Guy is wary that this might be a short-lived phenomenon, with the real DRAM shortage beginning early in the second half of this year

The trick is to ignore the temporary drop or reshuffle to stocks that will pop up the most. Me I just stay in my current great stocks.

Topic.Title: Folks, everyone needs to keep calm

Message.Msg: ~ 20 miles, a distance I strive to maintain or exceed at all times. Any closer and Logan is probably involved, which doubles the pain. Speaking of distances and the bay state, how far away are you from that Martha's Vineyard limerick? Unless your standards for rhyme are astronomically higher than you your standards for spelling, you should have 4 or 5 pisspoor verses by now. While it's true that Plato's redheaded stepchildren haven't been playing well together lately, you can't expect the adults to be everywhere all the time unless and until you give them all the cameras and microphones and safety patrols and software weenies they need. I'll bet the adults were already monitoring the neighborhood closely enough to solve this case in a hurry, just not closely enough to prevent it, a hard-to-refute funding argument indeed. Other death-spiral industries are bound to take a hit or two from this latest episode of playground violence, though few adults in the paper industry will be found arguing for more cameras or more oversight from schoolmarms named Elizabeth. The real problem is not that everyone thinks this effects WS, it's that everyone thinks everyone ELSE thinks it effects WS, so it effects WS. Uh-oh, that's zen-whipping, most un-zen-like, Buddha's bones, that'll show up on my next karmic installment bill.... which reminds me, did you ever find phu mu? In other breaking Boston news, Stevie seems to have run the Wampanoags off their own reservation, or at least their Monsanto Chemical site claim. This week he doubled down by unveiling plans for a second Everett-South broken-back mirage, an identical twin sister in Philadelphia he claims will reduce construction costs for both. Highly logical, the City of Brotherly Love is one of the few places with sites to rival the historic charm, cultural richness and abundant natural beauty of Everett. Sunday's episode of the simpsons did a riff on 'Streetcar' that included millhouse crying "Shut up, Fellas!"
